title: Can we relate Dravidians with Shudras? - Quora

response.answer_text: Dr B R Ambedkar is of the view that there were no Aryan or Dravidian races. Dravida means a location, Arya means a noble one. They are not races. According to Varnashra Dharma, all are born Sudras, by accepting to take up an occupation he becomes a dwija (twice born), by learning the Vedas he becomes wise and learned, and by realizing the Brahman he becomes a Brahmin! Janmana jayathe sudraha, Karmana jayathe dwija, Vedoadhyayi baved vipraha, Brahma janathi Brahmanaha- from Smriti. How does the “Dravidians” who do not exist become Sudras?

No we cannot relate shudras with Dravidians because shudras is Aryans cast .When Aryan came to India they pushed dravidians towards south. During the later Vedic era there were four cast Brahmin Khetri bisaya and sudras. Therefore shudras are Aryans.

Why would you even relate an entire regional community with a caste system section that was introduced millennia ago. Dravidians were a regional community just like Aryans. Dravidians lived in South of India while Aryans occupied North of India.
